job_title: Program Facilitator in New Westminster, BC
pros: time flexibility and amazing co-workers
cons: I don't see any cons

pros:
The organization has good values. There is no doubt that they are making a difference in the community and the clients best interests are at heart. 
If you have something to offer the agency as an employee I believe that Human Resources sees the value in you.
cons:
-Operational Management could use some work, it is very old school and needs to be progressive in order to aquire new funding possibilities.  
-Not all positions are posted internally, some people are just moved into new positions or Mat Leaves so you have no opportunity to vye for them. 
-There are some people in positions who are very unqualified but talk a good game and made nice with the powers that be so they ended up getting compensated nicely and putting departments in precarious situations. 
-There isn't much room for financial advancement, promises are often made and broken.
